title: Chicken Arroz Caldo (Chicken Rice Porridge) Recipe
description: This arroz caldo is a comforting Filipino soup with chicken wings and rice in chicken broth, seasoned with onion, garlic, ginger, and fish sauce.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Chicken Arroz Caldo (Chicken Rice Porridge) 4.8 (93) 69 Reviews 33 Photos Arroz caldo is a comforting and flavorsome Filipino rice and chicken soup served mainly as a snack but can be enjoyed any time of the day. Submitted by lola Updated on November 12, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 33 33 33 33 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 5 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This arroz caldo recipe will warm you up from the inside out.  What Is Arroz Caldo?  Arroz caldo is a lugaw (glutinous rice dish) made with chicken and rice. It’s flavored with garlic, onions, ginger, fish sauce, and other seasonings.  Though “arroz caldo” is a Spanish name, the dish’s origins are Filipino — it is an adaptation of a congee that was created by Chinese-Filipino immigrants.  How to Make Arroz Caldo Cook the onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add the chicken and stir in the fish sauce.Pour in the broth and sweet rice, then bring the mixture to a boil.Season and continue cooking until the chicken is fully cooked.  How to Serve Arroz Caldo This arroz caldo recipe calls for green onions, lemon wedges, and more fish sauce as toppings. Add a hard-boiled egg, a traditional arroz caldo garnish, for extra heartiness. How to Store Arroz Caldo Store your leftover arroz caldo in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to three days. Store the garnishes separately for the best results. Reheat thoroughly on the stove or in the microwave, then add the garnishes just before serving.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “Amazing,” raves one Allrecipes community member. “Great recipe as-is, and you can always add more aromatics. I did. Extra ginger and garlic for me!” “Like my mom made for us...yum,” says Peach. “Garnished with fried chicken skin, toasted garlic, safflower, and green onion. Always use fresh garlic and ginger — it makes all the difference and smells and tastes amazing.” “This is the BEST arroz caldo recipe,” according to Lindsay Ceballos. “It has become a staple in our house. I do use regular white rice (with a little extra boil time) and whatever chicken I have on hand and it always comes out perfectly.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 onion, diced 2 cloves garlic, crushed 1 (2 inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced 2 ¼ pounds chicken wings, split and tips discarded 1 tablespoon fish sauce (Optional) 5 ¼ cups chicken broth 1 cup glutinous sweet rice salt and pepper to taste 1 green onion, chopped 1 lemon, sliced (Optional) 1 teaspoon fish sauce for sprinkling, if desired (Optional) Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook and stir onion, garlic, and ginger in hot oil until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add chicken wings; cook and stir for 1 minute. Stir in fish sauce, cover, and cook another 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour chicken broth into the pot. Stir in sweet rice and bring mixture to a boil. Cover and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent rice from sticking to the bottom of the pot. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season with salt and pepper. Portion soup into bowls and garnish with green onion. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve with lemon slices and additional fish sauce, if desired. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 179 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 294 Calories 15g Fat 25g Carbs 16g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 294 % Daily Value * Total Fat 15g 19% Saturated Fat 3g 16% Cholesterol 42mg 14% Sodium 1586mg 69% Total Carbohydrate 25g 9% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 4g Protein 16g 31% Vitamin C 21mg 23% Calcium 38mg 3% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 209mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken Arroz Caldo (Chicken Rice Porridge) 01 of 33 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 33 Photo by  fgodghlmpx 01/28/2024 03 of 33 Photo by  Van Busk 06/03/2022 I also add carrots and use a chicken stock cubes. 04 of 33 Photo by  myla 02/05/2022 Easy to make. The amount of garlic, onions and ginger that I used was based on taste. I did not measure the amount. But I definitely used a lot of ginger and garlic :-). I used chicken bouillon instead of fish sauce and I used 1/2 glutinous white rice and 1/2 regular rice so it's not as thick (tip from my mom). I used fried garlic from a jar for convenience. I used chicken breasts instead of chicken wings. 05 of 33 Photo by  Jason D10 08/29/2020 06 of 33 Photo by  Carley Harden Verceles 02/18/2020 07 of 33 Photo by  readnbake 11/03/2019 08 of 33 Photo by  Sumirechan 04/03/2019 09 of 33 Photo by  rachel 08/20/2018 10 of 33 Photo by  Roxy Bautista 06/05/2018 The recipe is perfect! I just added some fried garlic, crispy chicken skin and tofu in soy vinegar sauce. 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Crab Omelet 6 Ratings Pinoy Chicken Adobo 38 Ratings Bringhe 9 Ratings Chicken Tinola 101 Ratings Pochero 3 Ratings Siopao (Filipino Steamed Dumplings) 25 Ratings Famous Chicken Adobo 364 Ratings Filipino Rice (Arroz Valenciana) Filipino Fried Chicken 1 Rating Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk) 48 Ratings Guinataan Chicken Adobo 36 Ratings Chicken with Chicharo (Snow Peas) 5 Ratings Salmon Sarciado 30 Ratings Pork Sinigang 32 Ratings Leyley's Spicy Chicken Adobo Wings 10 Ratings Champorado 11 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
